what: Supporting ‘a new wave of ggplot2 extenders’
title: Personal Website Built with pkgdown
text: growing population ggplot2 ‘super-users’ – given regular long-term ggplot2 use – strong working knowledge grammar graphics principles ggplot2’s user interface. Among ranks statistics educators, data visualization professionals, data scientists statisticians. assertion project many ggplot2 super-users find creating ggplot2 extensions valuable, current educational materials falling short reaching enabling many group. ’ll discuss new material tailored group introduce new points entry.  easy geom recipes: diving defining compute_group ggprotos geom recipes: cases compute_group enough (compute_panel) ggtedius workshop Coordinating ggplot2 extenders meetup/support group function (x, file = “data”, ncolumns = (.character(x)) 1 else 5, append = FALSE, sep = " “) cat(x, file = file, sep = c(rep.int(sep, ncolumns - 1),”"), append = append) <bytecode: 0x7ff2991e1858> <environment: namespace:base>

title: Personal Website Built with pkgdown
text: Hello welcome! ’m data scientist, software developer, educator passionate using visualization facilitate communication data statistical principles. ’m particularly motivated elegance power “Grammar Graphics” framework, exploring empower ggplot2 users take advantage extension space 1) working new extension packages statistical education 2) providing new points entry ggplot2 world (tutorials/recipes well community building). last three years, ’ve worked Dean’s Data Cell United States Military Academy West Point data analytics teaching dual role. worked closely stakeholders members data team deliver actionable insights meet institutional reporting requirements. worked Deans Data Cell infrastructure towards code-first, reproducible elegant data products easily interpreted wide audience. also taught sections Introduction Statistics Probability (MA206) Mathematics Department, oversaw five independent studies focused tool-building statistical education (Brown McGovern Fall AY2022, Brown Spring AY2022, Folorunso Jax Spring AY2023). Fall AY2018-Spring AY2020, taught statistical methodology University Denver’s Korbel School International Studies. period, won R Consortium, allowed work six graduate student researchers advance project (Granier, Goodman, Picci, Thapa, Surrency, Woodrum). previously lectured Technische Universität Dresden’s Center International Studies international organizations statistical methodology (Spring AY2016 Spring AY2018). PhD University Illinois, dissertation won Burkholder Award Best Dissertation Political Science Department University Illinois. focus international institutions law especially area security. broadly, areas study International Relations, Methodology, Comparative Politics emphasis Latin American Politics. dissertation focused compliance supranational law, focusing UN Security Council resolutions principle case; conducted dissertation field research Brazil Federal House Deputies. PhD, worked statistics consultant, Applied Technologies Arts Science (ATLAS), University Illinois 2013-2015. also served “Methods TA” Political Science 2015-2016 academic year University Illinois, providing assistance expertise undergraduate graduate students. TU Dresden, 2018, designed taught course introducing students data science tools statistical analysis political research. awarded Fulbright Fellowship (Argentina 2008), Foreign Language Area Studies Fellowships (2009-2011), Nelle Signor Travel Fellowship (Brazil 2011) participated specialized workshops including Empirical Implications Theoretical Models (2010), Public Policy Nuclear Threats (2013), Berkeley Institute Transparency Social Sciences (2015) workshops, Zurich Summer School Women Political Methodology (2017), Lorentz Workshop: Empirical Research International Organizations (2018). Previously academic career, worked U.S. Department Commerce’s Bureau Industry Security chemical biological export controls worked lithium-ion battery failure diagnostics Chemical Engineering Division Argonne National Laboratory.
